etymology.description: Depicts a horse with head facing left and flowing mane -> head often simplified into an eye 目(目) (mù, "eye") -> legs evolved into four dots 灬 unrelated to 火(火) (huǒ, "fire")
etymology.interpretation: The character represents a horse with its mane flowing sideways, and the simplification over time captured the essence of its most visible features.
etymology.simplification: 馬(馬) was simplified to 马(馬) by fusing the head and body, using the simplified line forms and dots to represent its features more compactly.

examples.chinese: 小马在草地上奔跑(小馬在草地上奔跑)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo mǎ zài cǎodì shàng bēnpǎo.
examples.english: The little horse runs on the grassland.

examples.chinese: 我骑马看风景(我騎馬看風景)，感觉非常自在(感覺非常自在)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ qí mǎ kàn fēngjǐng, gǎnjué fēicháng zìzài.
examples.english: I ride a horse to enjoy the scenery, feeling very at ease.

examples.chinese: 马是人类历史上的好伙伴(馬是人類歷史上的好夥伴)。
examples.pinyin: Mǎ shì rénlèi lìshǐ shàng de hǎo huǒbàn.
examples.english: Horses are good companions in human history.
